page.title: 01THE KIRKBURTON DISTRICT
page.content: Most of the twelve squares in our block are grass which is used for grazing, silage or hay. There are a few woods scattered about with farms and cottages here and there.The most interesting places are Emley Moor T.V Mast which is an outstanding landmark that can be seen from many miles away and Gryce Hall where Lord Savile lives, although there are also other places such as the Old People Home a Roman Catholic Church and a corner shop. which get most of its trade from the children who attend Kirkburton Middle School. There is a mine at Emley Moor and several disused pit shafts in the district. Although there isn't much to do in the way of entertainment, children go to riding schools and youth clubs, Cubs, Guides, Scouts, and Brownies.
